privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.section_1_text: I do not collect any personal data except for the information submitted via the contact form. This information is used solely to respond to your requests and is deleted after use.
privacy.section_2_text: The collected data is used only to respond to your inquiries. It is never shared with third parties unless necessary for communication management.
privacy.section_2_item_2: Handling requests via the contact form
privacy.section_3_text: I use a self-hosted tracker to analyze website performance. No data is collected for profit purposes. Tracker link: https://plausible.farmeurimmo.fr
privacy.section_4_text: For any questions regarding this privacy policy or to exercise your rights, you can contact me by email or via the contact form.
privacy.contact_form_label: Contact form available on the website.
privacy.third_party_services_text: Please note that some third-party services, such as Vercel and Cloudflare, may collect information related to site performance and security. These services are used solely to optimize the user experience and not for profit.
privacy.third_party_v2: Cloudflare: Site security and protection against attacks

projects.title: Reaper Sanction
projects.excerpt: Reaper Sanction is a Minecraft plugin that integrates a built-in sanction system and customizable GUIs for punishing server players. The GUIs are configurable and the sanctions are customizable.

projects.title: 1HTML Project – Vacation Rental Website
projects.excerpt: Completed individual project to create a responsive, accessible vacation rental website using only pure HTML and CSS, without frameworks or templates.

projects.title: 1Python Project – Snort & Dodgem Games
projects.excerpt: Individual project to implement two abstract strategy games in Python (Snort and Dodgem), focused on clean logic and terminal interface without libraries.

projects.title: My current and old projects
projects.description: Discover my past and current projects here. They are all open source and available on my GitHub account. You may find more projects on my GitHub account.

reapersanction.title: ReaperSanction, Sanction plugin via editable GUIs
reapersanction.description: ReaperSanction is a Minecraft plugin providing a comprehensive sanction system with customizable GUIs for efficient player management.
good_points: GUI-oriented sanction plugin for Java Minecraft servers
Compatible with Spigot, Paper, BungeeCord, Velocity
From 1.8 to the latest game versions.
reapersanction.demo: The plugin in a few pictures

install_instructions: Download the latest version of the plugin
Place the file in the plugins folders of your servers
Configure the plugin via the configuration files if needed
Be careful, the guis must be configured on spigot servers.

row_rs.description: Opens the sanction menu for the player

row_kick.description: Kicks a player from the server

row_banip.description: Bans an IP or a player

row_report.description: Opens the report menu configured with your reasons

row_history.description: Opens the player's sanction history menu

row_rsadmin.description: Reloads configs, retrieves plugin information, gets information to migrate to MYSQL.

wiki.custom_guis_description: See below the list of customizable menus with their exact names in the config.
wiki.how_guis_works: How the GUIs and messages file works
wiki.how_guis_works_description: The config is red on server startup and when you use the /rsadmin rl command. You can edit the config and use the command to reload it. The config may not order the GUIs in the same order you want. You can change the order of the GUIs, this will not affect the plugin.
wiki.location_inventories: The inventories file is located in: plugins/ReaperSanction/Inventories.yml
wiki.location_messages: The messages file is located in: plugins/ReaperSanction/Messages.yml
wiki.code:
MAIN: # <-- This is the main gui
  name: §4ReaperSanction # <-- The name of the gui
  size: 27 # <-- The size of the gui (9, 18, 27, 36, 45, 54)
  # Slots start at 0 and end at size - 1,
  # If you place an item in a slot outside of the gui size, it can cause errors
  isFill: true
  # If isFill is true, the gui will be filled with a glass pane
  # The option to customize the glass pane will be added in the future
  items: # <-- The items of the gui
    '8': # <-- The slot of the item
      type: ANVIL # <-- The type of the item
      amount: 1 # <-- The amount of the item
      display: §6What§cEver§1You§bWant # <-- The display name of the item
      lore: # <-- The lore of the item
        '0': Hi # <-- The line of the lore, you have to start at 0, incrementing by 1 and write like it is
        '1': Custom lore
        '2': With custom actions
      actions: # <-- The actions of the item
        '0': EXT->SAY HELLO %player%  # <- Similar to lore, you have to start at 0, incrementing by 1
        # More explanation about how and what is available below.
    '16': # Here is another item
      type: PAPER
      amount: 1
      display: §cEnd
      actions:
        '0': INT->GUI->END->%player%
wiki.ext_actions_description: EXT actions will force the player to execute the command. For example, if we have "EXT->SAY HELLO %player%", the player will execute: "/say HELLO %player%". %player% represents the player's name.
wiki.int_actions_description: INT actions will pass instructions to the plugin. For example, if we have "INT->TEMPBAN->%player%->7day->Fly", the plugin will temporarily ban the player for 7 days for "Fly".
wiki.int_actions_optional: INT actions can have optional arguments. For example, we can remove the reason for the action. If we have "INT->TEMPBAN->%player%->7day", the plugin will temporarily ban the player for 7 days with the default reason.

int_actions_endpoints.title: INT actions options
int_actions_endpoints.description: INT options are the possible actions that the plugin can perform without executing a command. The list of possible actions is below.

row_banip.description: Bans an IP or a player

row_unbanip.description: Unbans an IP or a player

row_gui.description: Opens a GUI (Not supported by sanction history, see GUI_DYN)

row_gui_dyn.description: Opens a dynamic GUI (It was made to open the sanction history GUI)

1html-project.title: 1HTML Project – Vacation Rental Website
1html-project.summary: Completed individual project carried out in October over a 3-week period as part of my training at SUPINFO.
1html-project.intro: I already had basic HTML knowledge before this project, which allowed me to focus more on content structure, responsive design, and accessibility.

presentation.title: Overview
presentation.text: The goal of this project was to create a fully functional website similar to AirBnB/Booking using only HTML and CSS, without any frameworks, libraries, templates, or generative AI. The focus was on code quality, responsive design, and accessibility compliance.

categories.title: Category Pages
items: Link to a detailed page for each property

constraints.title: Technical Constraints
items: 100% pure HTML/CSS code, written by hand

snort-dodgem.title: Combinatorial Strategy Mini-Games in Python
snort-dodgem.summary: Individual project coding two abstract strategy games: Snort and Dodgem.

description.title: General Description
description.text: This project consists of programming two abstract combinatorial strategy games in Python, with full rule management and console interface.

snort.title: Snort Game
snort.rules: Players alternately place a piece on an empty square not orthogonally adjacent to an opponent’s piece. The player who cannot move loses.
snort.functions: Functions include: board creation, display, placement validation, board update, and turn management.

dodgem.title: Dodgem Game
dodgem.rules: Move your pieces on a square board with direction restrictions. Win by moving all your pieces off the board or blocking the opponent.
dodgem.functions: Functions include: board initialization with pieces, display, move validation, input handling, and victory detection.
